definition: impotent (idiom)/powerless/helpless
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
surname Neng
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously

sentences.english: And god help the user who clicks on an intersection.
sentences.chinese: 还有，如果用户点击交叉口的话，系统也无能为力。

sentences.english: Dyslexic children often think they are unable to learn.
sentences.chinese: 有语言障碍的孩子常认为他们对学习无能为力。

sentences.english: FEW sensations of helplessness match that of driving a car that unexpectedly skids .
sentences.chinese: 开车过程中由于意外打滑而感到无能为力是很罕见的。
它对复制自己无能为力。

sentences.english: Without further evidence, Beal told her, there was nothing he could do.
sentences.chinese: Beal说没有进一步证据，他无能为力。

sentences.english: The general had exhausted all his means and could do nothing to hold back the enemy's attack.
sentences.chinese: 面对敌人的进攻，将军已计穷智短，无能为力。

sentences.english: For centuries, medicine was impotent and hence unproblematic.
sentences.chinese: 几个世纪以来，药品，是无能为力的，因此不成问题。

sentences.english: It destabilises the club and the players and we can't do anything about it.
sentences.chinese: 这会使军心动摇，不过我们对此也无能为力。

sentences.english: “Nothing much for us to do, ” the intern said grimly.
sentences.chinese: “我们根本无能为力了，”实习生伤感地说道。

sentences.english: I long to alleviate the evi1, but I can't, and I too suffer.
sentences.chinese: 我渴望去邪拔恶，但我无能为力，因此我也感到痛苦。

sentences.english: Even the Dowager had not been as incompetent.
sentences.chinese: 西太后本人当时并非是无能为力的。

sentences.english: To teach this, the perpetrator may experience dependency or powerlessness in some form.
sentences.chinese: 加害者会经历到某种形式的依赖或无能为力。

sentences.english: Except accept it, and be happy and love yourself and enjoy life.
sentences.chinese: 无能为力啊，除了接受它，好好爱自己，享受生活。

sentences.english: I cannot say forget me, but I would mention that there are impossibilities in the world.
sentences.chinese: 不能说让你忘了我，可世间总有无能为力之事。

sentences.english: We can do nothing about the offender if your trade-mark is not registered.
sentences.chinese: 如果你们的商标没有注册，我们对违法者无能为力。

definition: have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
powerless/lacking strength
to no avail/of no use
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
impossible
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to have no other choice
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
unhelpful/useless
to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
helpless/helplessness/feeling useless/no help
